meeting_summary: Regular meeting dominated by extensive public hearing on proposed residency requirements for appointed officials, with 31 public speakers overwhelmingly opposing the measure. Board tabled the proposal and two Planning Board alternate appointments after hearing public input. Multiple agreements with Town of Milton approved including library operations, events, capital projects, and pool operations.

votes.motion_description: Close Public Hearing on Proposed Local Law No. 1 of 2026 (Residency Requirements)

discussion.speaker: Trustee VanDeinse-Perez
discussion.statement: addresses the public request for board members view on the proposal- she doesn't support the proposal it's current form, but if it were to come back with revisions she may

discussion.speaker: Trustee DuBuque
discussion.statement: at first she did support the law, but after hearing from the public and since the residents are directly affected by this change, feels they do deserve to be heard. In it's present form she doesn't support it, amendments (45-5), some language changes could save those who have given so much and to be fair to the community not to lose those people. This board does exist to serve the resident tax payers. Feels the 5 board members can come together and create something that is worthy

discussion.speaker: Trustee Price-Bush
discussion.statement: Thanks everyone for speaking up, this is what public hearings are for, this was very successful

votes.notes: Closed at 8:45pm after extensive public comment with 31 speakers

votes.motion_description: Approve Wendy Richards be hired to paint the EML firehouse interior ($2,625.00)
votes.notes: Consent agenda item; vote result not explicitly stated

votes.motion_description: Approve Ballston Spa Public Library to set up account with Ingram Book Company (replacing Baker & Taylor going out of business)
votes.notes: Consent agenda item; Baker & Taylor going out of business; vote result not explicitly stated

votes.motion_description: Approve purchase of 200 tons of Morton's road salt by DPW ($12,514.00)
votes.notes: Consent agenda item; vote result not explicitly stated

votes.motion_description: Approve final payout of Retired Police Officer Edward Braim's accrued time (Vacation: 128 Hours; Sick: 206 Hours; Personal: 40 Hours; Comp: 38 Hours, Total $13,782.04)
Approve resolution granting authority to State of New York to adjust Village water valves on NY-50 (PIN 1811.50 pavement resurfacing and set aside SFY26B Project)
Approve retention agreement with Bartlett, Pontiff, Stewart, & Rhodes, P.C. for bond counsel services
Approve SEQRA Type 2 action related to Milton Water District #3 Pump House

discussion.speaker: Attorney Buettner
discussion.statement: explained that the type 2 action is necessary to move forward with the bonding authority for resolution e

votes.notes: Roll call vote; necessary for bonding authority

votes.motion_description: Approve borrowing authority of $600,000.00 related to Milton Water District #3

discussion.speaker: Attorney Buettner
discussion.statement: explained the rules of this authority

votes.motion_description: Approve Supplemental Agreement for engineering services by LaBella Associates, D.P.C. for Milton Water District #3 Improvements
Proposed Local Law No. 1 of 2026 (Residency Requirements for Appointed Officials, Planning Board Members, and Zoning Board Members)
votes.notes: Placeholder motion; no vote occurred at this meeting

votes.motion_description: Table Elizabeth Kormos appointment consideration as alternate to Planning Board
votes.notes: Roll call vote; Mayor abstained; tabled to allow for additional applicants

votes.motion_description: Table Benjamin Baskin appointment consideration as alternate to Planning Board
votes.notes: Roll call vote; Mayor abstained; tabled to allow for additional applicants; meeting recessed after outburst from resident; back in session at 9:41pm

votes.motion_description: Approve agreement between Village of Ballston Spa and Town of Milton related to Village Library's operations
Approve agreement between Village of Ballston Spa and Town of Milton related to Village events
Approve agreement between Village of Ballston Spa and Town of Milton related to Village Library's capital project
Approve agreement between Village of Ballston Spa and Town of Milton related to Village Swimming Pool operations
Approve voucher audit and adjourn meeting at 10:11pm
votes.notes: Total vouchers: $178,472.55 (General Fund: $174,687.07, Capital Projects: $2,183.68, Library Fund: $1,601.80)

public_comments.summary: Supports motions h and i; suggests Matt should be removed and replaced by one of the two candidates

public_comments.comment_text: made a statement thanking all who have supported the Library over the last year. Town of Milton also supports the Library and had a meeting and wanted to thank everyone for their support and looks forward to working with them.
public_comments.summary: Library Board member thanks supporters; notes Town of Milton support and looks forward to continued collaboration

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: Feels h and I should be tabled due to all the interest that has been brought up tonight. Made a statement regarding Liz Kormos's prior experience. Made a comment regarding Ben Baskins prior experience. Is against these appointments.
public_comments.summary: Opposes appointments h and i; suggests tabling due to public interest; commented on both candidates' experience

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: made a statement as to why people will not apply for the positions if their names are going to be brought up like this in front of the public.
public_comments.summary: Concerned that public discussion of candidates will deter people from applying for positions

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: feels the comment from Gina was inappropriate, we are supposed to encourage residents to apply, hopes the board can recognize that and supports both candidates.
public_comments.summary: Believes Gina's comment was inappropriate; emphasizes need to encourage residents; supports both candidates

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: Encourages people to go back and review older meetings by Mayor Fitzpatrick. Thinks it was wonderful that people came out and expressed concern.
public_comments.summary: Encourages reviewing past meetings from Mayor Fitzpatrick era; appreciates public turnout and engagement

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: this is reason why people do not step up for positions in village politics. Urged the Board and Mayor to consider the tenor of these meetings for why people do not participate.
public_comments.summary: Believes meeting tenor discourages civic participation; urges board and mayor to consider how meeting atmosphere affects volunteer recruitment

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: made a statement about every motion on the agenda she would like the boards opinions on each vote so they get to know the board members.
public_comments.summary: Requests board members explain their votes on every motion to help community know trustees better

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: Agrees with Lisa Spidel. On motion h supports Liz's candidacy. He applied in case there was no one else, he is happy to let others who would like to have the chance to participate in this government. If they don't then he is happy to contribute.
public_comments.summary: Agrees with transparency request; supports Liz Kormos for Planning Board; willing to step aside for other applicants but happy to serve if needed

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: made a statement about Liz Kormos' nomination, doesn't make sense to change to a new law if there are people who want to apply, agrees it makes sense to table these 2 nominations to make room for new people but otherwise these two people should be considered based on qualifications.
public_comments.summary: Questions changing law when people want to apply; supports tabling nominations to allow new applicants but believes candidates should be judged on qualifications

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: commented thanking the board and prior members of the board, made a statement about community interest forms, seems like same people keep making it to the boards, looking for change and improvements try to find them.
public_comments.summary: Thanks board; notes same people repeatedly appointed; seeks change and improvements in board recruitment

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: h and I given all the interest tonight, we should consider tabling these two to open it up to other people. Need to reach out to public.
public_comments.summary: Suggests tabling h and i due to public interest; advocates for reaching out to public for more applicants

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: since g is going to be tabled, she supports moving forward with h and I since they are appointments as alternates. Village residents should be on these boards, need a diversity of opinions.
supports: moving forward with h and i
public_comments.summary: Since proposal g tabled, supports proceeding with alternate appointments h and i; emphasizes need for village residents and diversity of opinions

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Any Issue
public_comments.comment_text: h & I, made a statement regarding putting off the Alternate candidates. Would prefer other people, but if no one else applies is it worth putting them off 2 more weeks.
public_comments.summary: Questions value of delaying alternate appointments if no other applicants emerge in two weeks

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Any Issue
public_comments.comment_text: Wanted to welcome the new trustees, supports the idea of having the board give their feedback on why they decide or vote the way they did and like that Trustee VanDeinse-Perez listened to that feedback and voted to table.
public_comments.summary: Welcomes new trustees; supports board transparency in explaining votes; appreciates Trustee VanDeinse-Perez listening to feedback

public_comments.summary: Suggests improving recruitment process including better communication with all applicants; supports prior speaker's point about mayor abstaining

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Any Issue
public_comments.comment_text: Confused and wants Board to address what it plans to do to mitigate the appointment of the planning board members from the January 1st meeting.
public_comments.summary: Questions board's plan to address planning board appointments from January 1st meeting

board_response.response: replied no, Attorney advice session discussion cannot be shared

public_comments.summary: Questions board about immigration enforcement resolution from last 2025 meeting

public_comments.comment_text: recently requested Mayor clarify the property tool he created, claims she had been blocked by the mayor on his page.
public_comments.summary: Milton resident requests clarification on mayor's property tool; claims being blocked from mayor's social media page

board_response.response: responded that the page was unpublished and there would be more information when he speaks later

mayor_announcements.speaker: Mayor Rossi
mayor_announcements.announcement: Mayor will be taking some time off over the next few to take care of himself, not goodbye, just needs a breather. He made a statement regarding this announcement.

liaison_reports.report: Chocolate Fest Feb 6th at 5pm, Revitalize Ballston Spa will presenting at the Feb 8th BOT meeting, Fire Dept 2025 had 540 fire calls, represents 5,480 service hours. 2,354 hrs of training/ drills. 1,153 hrs of various specialized training.

announcements.detail: 540 fire calls (5,480 service hours), 2,354 hours training/drills, 1,153 hours specialized training

liaison_reports.report: Sledding down Bath St scheduled for March 7th 11-2pm, New President elected to the Friends of the Library and they also had a 3 month social media blitz campaign raised $24,000.

announcements.topic: Friends of the Library new president

announcements.detail: 3 month social media blitz campaign raised $24,000

liaison_reports.report: Historic District Commission holds its next meeting Feb 10th, COA touch of Woodwinds at Brookside Museum Feb 14th at 3pm. Program Music rescheduled to Feb 21st at 3 pm at Brookside Museum. Registration is strongly encouraged. Preparing for National Poetry month in April additional details will be shared as they develop. The Next meeting will be at Brookside Feb 11th, there is a vacancy for this committee- please apply if interested. (not subject to residency limits). Park and tree looking ahead to budget season, exploring improvements to Wiswall, Kelley park and Old Iron Spring. Consistent watering is set for the parks. Reach out if you are looking to plant a tree and feel free to reach out to them for any assistance needed.

announcements.detail: Vacancy exists, not subject to residency limits
Exploring improvements to Wiswall, Kelley park and Old Iron Spring; consistent watering planned

liaison_reports.report: DPW completed commercial water meter readings, started estimated readings. Received completed water leak detection survey. Continues to clean up water Dept on Lowe St., starting flooding the ice rink, installed School banners as part of the Front St beautification. Is preparing equipment and materials for this upcoming snowstorm to ensure safe and efficient operation. If you have a fire hydrant in your yard please make sure you shovel the snow from around it through the storm to help your community.
dpw_activities: Received completed water leak detection survey
Continuing water department cleanup on Lowe St
Installed school banners for Front St beautification
action_items: Residents should shovel snow from fire hydrants

other_business.speaker: Trustee Dunkelbarger
other_business.update: Responds to the outburst from a resident calling the Board members 'Cowards' for tabling the nominations. He clearly heard Mr. Baskin and Ms. Kormos withdraw their nominations if there were other people interested; they both said it which is why he supported the tabling of h and i.

other_business.speaker: Trustee DuBuque
other_business.update: Agrees with Trustee Dunkelbarger, they are doing their best, could have voted no, instead we tabled it which means not now. Let's get proper information to make sure we are making the best decision.

other_business.speaker: Trustee VanDeinse-Perez
other_business.update: Getting back to people, would be a good practice to start adopting.

action_items_summary: Improve communication with board applicants including those not selected
Residents should shovel snow from fire hydrants during storms
Provide more publicity for board position openings
Schedule budget appointments with Mayor through Jennifer
Continue exploring park improvements for Wiswall, Kelley Park, and Old Iron Spring
